trans-unit.source: Allows a 2-D brush, like a <xref href="System.Windows.Media.SolidColorBrush"></xref> or <xref href="System.Windows.Media.TileBrush"></xref>, to be applied to a specularly-lit 3-D model.
<xref:System.Windows.Media.Media3D.SpecularMaterial> adds color to other materials applied to a mesh, rather than subtracting it.
<xref:System.Windows.Media.Media3D.SpecularMaterial> applied to a mesh will be illuminated wherever specular highlights for the model occur.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Media3D.SpecularMaterial"></xref> class.
<xref:System.Windows.Media.Media3D.SpecularMaterial> adds color to other materials applied to a mesh, rather than subtracting it.
<xref:System.Windows.Media.Media3D.SpecularMaterial> applied to a mesh will be illuminated wherever specular highlights for the model occur.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Media3D.SpecularMaterial"></xref> class with the specified brush and specular exponent.
<xref:System.Windows.Media.Media3D.SpecularMaterial> adds color to other materials applied to a mesh, rather than subtracting it.
<xref:System.Windows.Media.Media3D.SpecularMaterial> applied to a mesh will be illuminated wherever specular highlights for the model occur.
The brush applied by the new <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Media3D.SpecularMaterial"></xref>.
The specular exponent.
Gets or sets the [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_2d](~/includes/tlasharptla-2d-md.md)] brush to apply to a specularly-lit [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_3d](~/includes/tlasharptla-3d-md.md)] model.
If no texture coordinates are specified for a <xref:System.Windows.Media.Media3D.MeshGeometry3D>, its material might not render as expected.
The only exception is when this property specifies a <xref:System.Windows.Media.SolidColorBrush>; in this case, the material will be rendered using a default set of texture coordinates.
Dependency Property Information
Identifier field
Metadata properties set to `true`
None
The brush to apply.
Identifies the <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Media3D.SpecularMaterial.Brush"></xref> dependency property.
Creates a modifiable clone of this <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Media3D.SpecularMaterial"></xref>, making deep copies of this object's values.
When copying dependency properties, this method copies resource references and data bindings (but they might no longer resolve) but not animations or their current values.
This method is used to produce modifiable copies of frozen <xref:System.Windows.Freezable> objects (or any <xref:System.Windows.Freezable> object).
For convenience, this method shadows the inherited version with a strongly typed implementation.
For more information, see <xref:System.Windows.Freezable.Clone%2A?displayProperty=fullName>.
A modifiable clone of the current object.
The cloned object's <xref href="System.Windows.Freezable.IsFrozen"></xref> property will be `false` even if the source's <xref href="System.Windows.Freezable.IsFrozen"></xref> property was `true.`
Creates a modifiable clone of this <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Media3D.SpecularMaterial"></xref> object, making deep copies of this object's current values.
Resource references, data bindings, and animations are not copied, but their current values are.
This method is used to produce modifiable copies of frozen <xref:System.Windows.Freezable> objects (or any <xref:System.Windows.Freezable> object).
For convenience, this method shadows the inherited version with a strongly typed implementation.
For more information, see <xref:System.Windows.Freezable.CloneCurrentValue%2A?displayProperty=fullName>.
A modifiable clone of the current object.
The cloned object's <xref href="System.Windows.Freezable.IsFrozen"></xref> property will be `false` even if the source's <xref href="System.Windows.Freezable.IsFrozen"></xref> property was `true`.
Gets or sets a value that filters the color properties of the material applied to the model.
This property has the effect of filtering the material applied to the model by the color value specified.
For example, setting this property to `Colors.Red` would occlude blue and green in the material.
Dependency Property Information
Identifier field
Metadata properties set to `true`
None
The color with which to filter the material.
Identifies the <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Media3D.SpecularMaterial.Color"></xref> dependency property.
The identifier for the <xref:System.Windows.Media.Media3D.SpecularMaterial.Color%2A> dependency property.
Gets or sets a value that specifies the degree to which a material applied to a 3-D model reflects the lighting model as shine.
Specular lighting reproduces the appearance of surfaces that are shiny or tend to reflect highlights.
This property indicates the relative "shininess" of the material applied to the model.
A larger value for this property specifies greater size and sharpness of the shine reflected by the material.
Dependency Property Information
Identifier field
Metadata properties set to `true`
None

Relative contribution, for a material applied as a [!INCLUDE[TLA2#tla_2d](~/includes/tla2sharptla-2d-md.md)] brush to a [!INCLUDE[TLA2#tla_3d](~/includes/tla2sharptla-3d-md.md)] model, of the specular component of the lighting model.
Identifies the <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Media3D.SpecularMaterial.SpecularPower"></xref> dependency property.
